text: today we're delving into the
life-changing mind-altering teachings of
Don Miguel Ruiz and his books The Four
Agreements this short but powerful book
uses principles of ancient Toltec wisdom
to explain just how easy it is to
completely transform your life for the
better using only your mindset
originating from southern Mexico in the
city of pyramids the Toltec were known
as men and women of knowledge who had
formed a society to explore and conserve
the spiritual knowledge and practices of
ancient civilization the held beliefs
about Freedom happiness and love that
today can transform the average person's
mindset from self-doubt and pain to Joy
and fulfillment one important lesson
that the Toltec teach is the idea of the
Smoky mirror for this lesson everyone in
the world is a mirror we are all much
more alike than we think we are when
looking at each other we should
recognize our similarities and treat
others with empathy and kindness however
the smoke in between the mirror stops us
from being being able to recognize
ourselves in others it dampens our
awareness and keeps us from relating to
others and being truly happy there's a
way to help us see through this smoke
and these are The Four Agreements The
First Agreement is to be impeccable with
your word words are powerful and the
language we use to describe ourselves
and our environment matters a lot if we
choose to gossip and think negatively
about people or the world around us we
will end up suffering more in fact we
can see the effect negative language can
have on us in a scientific study from
2021 scientists assigned two groups to
read two different stories one group
ready story that used a lot of negative
words like stressed sad dirty and bad
the other group was given a very similar
story but this one used more positive
language like excited strong good and
happy the results show that the group
that read the positive story were in a
better mood then you guessed it those
that read the story with negative
language this study and others like it
prove that being careful with our words
can play a huge role in how we feel
throughout the day even the way we speak
to ourselves or self-talk is essential
to our happiness and overall confidence
take a look at one of our previous
videos that does a deeper dive into
self-talk in the description box below
this brings us to our second agreement
don't take anything personally as human
beings we spend a lot of time in our
heads this can make it feel like every
interaction or opinion formed about us
is extremely important however according
to the Toltec the way a person acts or
what they say is a reflection of
themselves and they're in a world rather
than you Miguel Ruiz describes hurtful
treatment from others as their emotional
garbage and by taking it personally you
take their emotional garbage and start
forming your own if you want to dig
deeper into this there's a course on
Mindvalley called tapping into emotional
Mastery by Jennifer Patridge inside she
shows you how to jump into the driver's
seat of your emotions and overhaul the
emotional garbage that we carry around
this enables you to find and heal the
wounds which might be the root cause of
your anxiety and self-doubt mind value
for those who don't know is an online
educational platform that provides
courses programs and resources on a
variety of self-improvement topics such
as meditation and Entrepreneurship check
out the description down below to become
a Mindvalley member today full
disclosure we are Affiliates of
Mindvalley so we do get compensated if
you sign up now back to the topic at
hand moving on to our third agreement
don't make assumptions our minds have a
tendency to make all kinds of
assumptions about situations when we
don't know the whole picture we tend to
fill in the blanks to try to better
understand what others might be feeling
for example we could assume that a
friend canceling plans means that they
don't enjoy our company when in reality
it could have been that they had a
really rough day or just couldn't make
it for other reasons we create negative
stories and emotional garbage when we
assume the worst about a situation if
you think back to the Smoky mirror idea
you can see how making an assumption
would add to the smoke and stop us from
relating to the other person and being
truly happy to stop us from making
assumptions Miguel Ruiz rights that we
should ask questions about situations
and gather as much information as we can
before coming to any conclusions this
saves us unnecessary suffering when we
remain open to any reality rather than
assuming the worst the final agreement
comes after we've mastered all the rest
and is essentially the cherry on top of
the agreement cake this is about taking
actions to achieve your goals and it is
to always do your best this agreement is
about giving your best shot in
everything you do your best isn't
perfection or anything more than what
you can realistically achieve and it can
look different depending on the day some
days just getting out of your bed is
your best and others running a marathon
might be your best doing your best is
relative to how you feel on a certain
day by giving your all to every
challenge you face you start to become
someone others can rely on and more
importantly if you do your best you'll
have no regrets and eventually with
practice your best will become better
and better until you are truly living to
your full potential living and
practicing these ancient Toltec
agreements can be truly life-changing
what do you think comment below with
which agreements resonate the most with
you and as always stay tuned
